info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 1 at 5:03PM MDT until August 1 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest New Mexico, including the following counties, in south central New Mexico, Sierra. In southwest New Mexico, Grant.
* WHEN...Until 815 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 503 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall of up to 0.5 to 1 inch is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Gila Hot Springs, Copperas Vista Black Canyon Camp Ground, and Rocky Canyon Camp Ground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT THIS EVENING
